clues.text: Ohm's law describes the relationship between current, resistance & this, noted as V
Jacques Charles formulated the law saying the volume of a fixed amount of gas under constant pressure is directly proportional to this
No. 1 of Kepler's 3 laws of planetary motion stated the planets got in their workout via orbits of this shape
His equation specifies how probability waves are altered by external influences; his cat just asks, am I alive or not?!
We're standing on principle--this Swiss mister's principle on how a fluid's speed relates to the fluid's pressure
This second king of Israel conquered Jerusalem from the Jebusites around 1000 B.C. & made it the capital of his people
One of the great empires of its age, Assyria ruled from its capital of Nineveh on the upper reaches of this river
The Norte Chico civilization built pyramids in what's now this S. Amer. nation c. 2600 B.C., around the time of the ones in Egypt
This Bronze Age culture on Crete was the first high civilization of the Aegean & reached its peak somewhere around 1600 B.C.
King Tut's father was this religious reformer who abandoned & attacked the old religion of Egypt
X-tract the X from a type of fisticuffs to get this sound of a rebounding spring
Drop the X from the milky substance of certain plants to get this synonym for delayed
Disable the X in a shaft beneath your car & have a refreshing glass of this
Strip the X from a building added on to a larger one & hail this 18th century English monarch
Remove the X from within a statement of a basic principle & you do this, inflict a severe injury
This irreverent character tells King Lear "Thou hadst little wit in thy bald crown when thou gav'st thy golden one away"
A companion for Juliet's whole life, she's known by her occupation, but gets to tell us her dead daughter was named Susan
The boatswain appears in the first scene of this play & again, surprised not to be drowned, in the last
In "Henry V" the guy with this job of announcing & proclaiming has a name, Montjoy; in "Othello" he's nameless
All 5 words of it, it's the most famous line spoken by the soothsayer in "Julius Caesar"
Tympanoplasty is a surgery to fix this part of your ear if it becomes perforated
This century-old cotton swab brand should not be used to clear out ear wax--it can damage your ears & push the wax in deeper
Low frequencies stimulate the top of the spiral in this inner ear organ that's coiled 2 1/2 times around a central pillar
The external part of the ear is called the pinna or this, a homophone of a tech company
Also called the anvil, this middle ear bone transmits vibrations from the malleus to the stapes

Legally coerced to be a good neighbor, in 2024 this company was there to pay $2 million over unfair claims practices in Montana
In 2022, massive mismanagement of auto loans & mortgages had this bank circling its wagons after a $3.7 billion penalty
"Credit" where credit is due--this big-on-secrecy European bank took a $2.5 billion hit for helping Americans evade taxes
The company that's now just GSK still had this longer name when it got a $3 billion fine in part for promoting drugs for unapproved uses
In 2013 this energy co. once run by a pre-veep Dick Cheney paid $200,000 for destroying Deepwater Horizon oil spill evidence
Not a happy Valentine's Day, 1779 for Captain James Cook, killed by locals in what is now this state
In 2007 the 3rd wife of the Earl of Shaftesbury was put on trial for his murder near this cinephile haven on the French Riviera
The "Monte Carlo Trunk Murder" got an 1879 Wimbledon finalist sentenced to this "diabolical" place off South America
On June 20, 1947 this gangster who helped develop Las Vegas crapped out, killed in a hail of bullets in Beverly Hills
In 1929 this notorious man from the Midwest skipped a Miami warrant, claiming pneumonia, but agents found he enjoyed a boat trip
Guglielmo Cortusi of Padua is among many European chroniclers who left mournful accounts of this outbreak of 1347-1351
The "Heimskringla" traces Norwegian kings from this god to Magnus Erlingsson
The "Chronicon Regum Legionensium" is the "Chronicle of" them--Spanish rulers, not a 21st century rock band
A 12th century history of this country includes Boleslaw III's wars with the Pomeranians
Andrew of Wyntoun's "Orygynale Cronykil" of this land includes the tale of "Thre Werd Systrys"
A 2-letter, 11-point Scrabble killer, "za" is accepted as a slangy shortening of this
No vowels? No problem! You can score 15 points with phpht, & if anyone objects, tell 'em it's this part of speech
You need just 5 letters to score 18 points with this Japanese dumpling
The single most played word in Scrabble tournaments consists of these 2 letters pronounced with a "ch" sound
It takes 9 letters, but if you can play this end-of-the-alphabet wine, score 22 points & pour yourself a glass

It was the year Aretha Franklin released the album "Aretha Arrives"
It was the year Jackie Robinson broke the color barrier in Major League Baseball
It was the year Jack Kerouac's "On the Road" was first published
It was the year Amelia Earhart disappeared

rounds.comments: (Ken: Each title will contain one of those two words.)

clues.text: After a decades-long ban, Saudi Arabia re-opened movie theaters in 2018; the first film shown was this Chadwick Boseman flick
Perhaps proving the film's title, Woody Harrelson's slam dunks in this 1992 movie were done on a slightly lowered hoop
In this 1997 blockbuster, Tommy Lee Jones played a "galaxy defender" in Ray-Ban sunglasses
Because he's a vegetarian, Kal Penn is actually eating veggie sliders in this 2004 comedy
In this 2020 adaptation of an Anna Sewell novel, Kate Winslet provides the voice of the titular horse

rounds.text: Regarding the idea of "women first", she queried, "Women demand equal rights on land--why not on sea?"
